data.text: @eekymom @stormchaseguide @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel Still paying on my husband's injury.
@stormchaseguide @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel I agree. The lack of compensation for verified injuries is criminal. Especially when that fact is downplayed and it was presented otherwise

@eekymom @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel The manufacturer for J&J put tinnitus on the label, and published the risk in NEJM, but the idea this will be in CICP's tables until the FDA or CDC recognizes it is laughable (EMA did). Then again, costs for MRIs w/ unilateral tinnitus to rule out tumors is probably minor to them
@stormchaseguide @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel Wouldn’t that be nice? I shouldn’t have thousands in collections due to a CDC confirmed vaccine injury. Filed CICP in August.
@jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel Maybe CICP will pay out those with identified related adverse events? I don't know, decreasing concerns of financial burdens may help with vaccination, just a thought...
@notquitegonzo @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel Long covid is what people miss while “experts” worry only about mortality rates and how hard masks are.
@LastGreatAct @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel Then they'll test to figure out which organ(s) are fkd

@LastGreatAct @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel No doubt. My point is that ppl incl myself have to deal with an uncertain recovery that effects us for weeks to months. Doctors are like yep could take months, or you could have long covid and/or permanent damage 🤷‍♂️ gotta wait like 3 months or more & then maybe will look into it
@notquitegonzo @jeremyfaust @ZekeEmanuel Long covid a not a myth.
